AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1602c

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

1.[šhr | ygl | bn | ydʿʾb | mlk | qtbn | ṣry | w-sfḥ | bn | ḥṭbm | mḥ=] 2.[rm | ʿm | ḏ-dwnm | w-bn | rṣfm | mḥrm | ʾnby | šymn | w-bn | tḥt | šms] 3.[w-rbʿ | šhr | ʾdm-s | mʿdkrb | bn | hybr | w-wdʾl | bn | rbḥ | w-ʾḫhy-] 4.[smy | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | bn | snṣfm | w-skt | w-ʾḫḏ | w-] 5.[gddm | l-ʿṣm | wdm | w-bntm | w-šftm | l-ʿm | w-ʾṯrt | n-l | ystfḥwn] 6.[ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | b-ʿlw | ḏt | mḥrtn | w-ṣry | šhr | ʾdm-s] 7.[ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | b-ṣdq-sm | ḥg | ḏt | mḥrtn | w-ʾsṭrn] 8.[w-ṯfṭ | šhr | ʾdm-s | ʾrby | ḏ-lbḫ | l-sṭr | w-ftḫ | ḏtn | ʾsṭrn | b-srn] 9.[lbḫ | w-b | mḥd-sm | b-byt | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | b-ḏ | ġylm | wrḫ-s | ḏ-bšmm | ḫr=] 10.[f | ʿmʿly | ḏ-ġrbm | qdmn | w-ḏn | ʾsdn | ʾrby | ḏ-lbḫ | ʾlḏy | b-ʿlw | ml=] 11.[kn | nḥql | ḏ-bn | ṣḥf | dtnt | w-šwb | w-ṯmr | ʿm | w-tʿlm-ʾy | yd | šhr] 12.[w-tqdm | w-sʿšq | ʾsṭr | ḏn | brṯn] 13.[nbṭʿm | bn | ʾlsmʿ | bn | hybr | ḏ-ʾ=] 14.[mnt | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-ʾrby-s]

šhr ygl bn ydʿʾb mlk qtbn ṣry w-sfḥ bn ḥṭbm mḥ=
rm ʿm ḏ-dwnm w-bn rṣfm mḥrm ʾnby šymn w-bn tḥt šms
w-rbʿ šhr ʾdm-s mʿdkrb bn hybr w-wdʾl bn rbḥ w-ʾḫhy-
smy ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm bn snṣfm w-skt w-ʾḫḏ w-
gddm l-ʿṣm wdm w-bntm w-šftm l-ʿm w-ʾṯrt n-l ystfḥwn
ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm b-ʿlw ḏt mḥrtn w-ṣry šhr ʾdm-s
ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm b-ṣdq-sm ḥg ḏt mḥrtn w-ʾsṭrn
w-ṯfṭ šhr ʾdm-s ʾrby ḏ-lbḫ l-sṭr w-ftḫ ḏtn ʾsṭrn b-srn
lbḫ w-b mḥd-sm b-byt ʿm ḏ-lbḫ b-ḏ ġylm wrḫ-s ḏ-bšmm ḫr=
f ʿmʿly ḏ-ġrbm qdmn w-ḏn ʾsdn ʾrby ḏ-lbḫ ʾlḏy b-ʿlw ml=

w-tqdm w-sʿšq ʾsṭr ḏn brṯn
nbṭʿm bn ʾlsmʿ bn hybr ḏ-ʾ=
mnt ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-ʾrby-s

šhr ygl bn ydʿʾb mlk qtbn ṣry w-sfḥ bn ḥṭbm mḥ=

w-rbʿ šhr ʾdm-s mʿdkrb bn hybr w-wdʾl bn rbḥ w-ʾḫhy-
smy ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm bn snṣfm w-skt w-ʾḫḏ w-
gddm l-ʿṣm wdm w-bntm w-šftm l-ʿm w-ʾṯrt n-l ystfḥwn
ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm b-ʿlw ḏt mḥrtn w-ṣry šhr ʾdm-s
ʾrby ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-tʾnṯ-sm b-ṣdq-sm ḥg ḏt mḥrtn w-ʾsṭrn
w-ṯfṭ šhr ʾdm-s ʾrby ḏ-lbḫ l-sṭr w-ftḫ ḏtn ʾsṭrn b-srn
lbḫ w-b mḥd-sm b-byt ʿm ḏ-lbḫ b-ḏ ġylm wrḫ-s ḏ-bšmm ḫr=
f ʿmʿly ḏ-ġrbm qdmn w-ḏn ʾsdn ʾrby ḏ-lbḫ ʾlḏy b-ʿlw ml=
kn nḥql ḏ-bn ṣḥf dtnt w-šwb w-ṯmr ʿm w-tʿlm-ʾy yd šhr
w-tqdm w-sʿšq ʾsṭr ḏn brṯn
nbṭʿm bn ʾlsmʿ bn hybr ḏ-ʾ=
mnt ʿm ḏ-lbḫ w-ʾrby-s

1.[Shahr Yagill bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has promulgated and decreed from Ḥaṭabum, the tem-] 2.[ple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and from Raṣafum, the temple of ʾAnbay-the patron-god-and on behalf of Shamas] 3.[and the protector of Shahr for his vassals Maʿdīkarib of the lineage of Haybar and Waddʾīl of the lineage of Rābiḥ and their kinsmen,] 4.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives, without any shortcomings or cessation or detraction or] 5.[termination, for the patronage-tie of friendship and affiliation and protection, for (the sake of) ʿAmm and ʾAthīrat. Let, then,] 6.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives hold themselves bound to this commandment. And Shahr has decreed for his vassals,] 7.[the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives with their concurrence, in accordance with this commandment and (these) records.] 8.[And Shahr has directed his vassals, the priests of Labakh, to inscribe and engrave these records in the valley] 9.[of Labakh and in their designated place in the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim. The month of Bashimum, the] 10.[first year of ʿAmmīʿalī Dhū-Gharībum. Now these individuals, the priests of Labakh who are in possess-] 11.[ion of property, in particular that which (is designated) in the document of Datīnat, and the products and the crops of ʿAmm. And it was signed by the hand of Shahr.] 12.[And Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ of the lineage of Haybar has directed and completed the inscriptions of this place,] 13.[under the pro-] 14.[tection of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests.]

tei:ab.tei:supplied: Shahr Yagill bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has promulgated and decreed from Ḥaṭabum, the tem-
ple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and from Raṣafum, the temple of ʾAnbay-the patron-god-and on behalf of Shamas
and the protector of Shahr for his vassals Maʿdīkarib of the lineage of Haybar and Waddʾīl of the lineage of Rābiḥ and their kinsmen,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives, without any shortcomings or cessation or detraction or
termination, for the patronage-tie of friendship and affiliation and protection, for the sake of ʿAmm and ʾAthīrat. Let, then,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives hold themselves bound to this commandment. And Shahr has decreed for his vassals,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives with their concurrence, in accordance with this commandment and these records.
And Shahr has directed his vassals, the priests of Labakh, to inscribe and engrave these records in the valley
of Labakh and in their designated place in the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim. The month of Bashimum, the
first year of ʿAmmīʿalī Dhū-Gharībum. Now these individuals, the priests of Labakh who are in possess-
ion of property, in particular that which is designated in the document of Datīnat, and the products and the crops of ʿAmm. And it was signed by the hand of Shahr.
And Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ of the lineage of Haybar has directed and completed the inscriptions of this place,
tection of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests.

div.tei:ab:
Shahr Yagill bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has promulgated and decreed from Ḥaṭabum, the tem-
ple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and from Raṣafum, the temple of ʾAnbay-the patron-god-and on behalf of Shamas
and the protector of Shahr for his vassals Maʿdīkarib of the lineage of Haybar and Waddʾīl of the lineage of Rābiḥ and their kinsmen,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives, without any shortcomings or cessation or detraction or
termination, for the patronage-tie of friendship and affiliation and protection, for the sake of ʿAmm and ʾAthīrat. Let, then,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives hold themselves bound to this commandment. And Shahr has decreed for his vassals,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives with their concurrence, in accordance with this commandment and these records.
And Shahr has directed his vassals, the priests of Labakh, to inscribe and engrave these records in the valley
of Labakh and in their designated place in the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim. The month of Bashimum, the
first year of ʿAmmīʿalī Dhū-Gharībum. Now these individuals, the priests of Labakh who are in possess-
ion of property, in particular that which is designated in the document of Datīnat, and the products and the crops of ʿAmm. And it was signed by the hand of Shahr.
And Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ of the lineage of Haybar has directed and completed the inscriptions of this place,
under the pro-
tection of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests.

Shahr Yagill bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has promulgated and decreed from Ḥaṭabum, the tem-
ple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānim and from Raṣafum, the temple of ʾAnbay-the patron-god-and on behalf of Shamas
and the protector of Shahr for his vassals Maʿdīkarib of the lineage of Haybar and Waddʾīl of the lineage of Rābiḥ and their kinsmen,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives, without any shortcomings or cessation or detraction or
termination, for the patronage-tie of friendship and affiliation and protection, for the sake of ʿAmm and ʾAthīrat. Let, then,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives hold themselves bound to this commandment. And Shahr has decreed for his vassals,
the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their wives with their concurrence, in accordance with this commandment and these records.
And Shahr has directed his vassals, the priests of Labakh, to inscribe and engrave these records in the valley
of Labakh and in their designated place in the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim. The month of Bashimum, the
first year of ʿAmmīʿalī Dhū-Gharībum. Now these individuals, the priests of Labakh who are in possess-
ion of property, in particular that which is designated in the document of Datīnat, and the products and the crops of ʿAmm. And it was signed by the hand of Shahr.
And Nabaṭʿamm bin ʾĪlīsamaʿ of the lineage of Haybar has directed and completed the inscriptions of this place,
under the pro-
tection of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and his priests.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
